p: The model of circuit theory highlighted “pinch points” of high level movement. In the current situation, several areas exhibited potentially high current flow; therefore, they likely indicate critical pathways for possible movement across suitable habitats (Figure 5a). As habitats shrink and narrow under the conditions modeled for the 2050s, movement will be facilitated by narrowed habitats and severely restricted (Figure 5b). From the least‐cost path and least‐cost corridors, we modeled linkages between current and future habitats (Figure 4a). These linkages emphasized routeways in which R. roxellana can navigate from current to future habitats.
